definition: to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: The twenty-seventh is my birthday, I plan to put up a marquee and throw a party .
sentences.chinese: 二十七是我的生日，我還要搭個棚呢，請請客。

sentences.english: They’d like to invite guests over more often, too.
sentences.chinese: 他們也希望能夠更多地請客人們到家裏去。

sentences.english: She seated the guest at the table.
This dinner is on me. Please order whatever you want to have.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我請客，你想喫什麼隨便點吧。

sentences.english: No, we'll go Dutch. I don't like to freeload.
sentences.chinese: 不，各付各的，我不喜歡讓別人請客。

sentences.english: Mom is going to invite some guests to dinner tonight.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽今晚要請客人喫飯。

sentences.english: They first registered to marry, then held a junketing in restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 他們先登記註冊結婚，然後在餐館請客。

sentences.english: The adjudicating personnel shall not accept a treat or gift from the parties or their agents.
sentences.chinese: 審判人員不得接受當事人及其訴訟代理人請客送禮。

sentences.english: Let's enjoy the performance played by pupils from Grade Two.
sentences.chinese: 請欣賞由二年級同學表演的兒童劇《小熊請客》。

sentences.english: This lunch is on me today.
You said this cup of wine to your treat, for him to come to see your performance.
sentences.chinese: 你說這杯酒要你請客，感謝他能夠過來看你的表演。

sentences.english: Although I didn't really want anything more to eat, I insisted on paying for the milkshakes.
sentences.chinese: 儘管我沒想再喫東西，我還是堅持由我來請客。

sentences.english: B: OK, loser buys pizza tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 好，輸的人明天晚上請客喫比薩餅。

definition: to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to reserve all the seats (or a large block of seats) at a theater, restaurant etc
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
